question: Which country was the location of the event the "Great Fire of Smyrna"?
explanation: The Great Fire of Smyrna or the Catastrophe of Smyrna destroyed much of the port city of Smyrna (modern Izmir, Turkey) in September 1922. Eyewitness reports state that the fire began on 13 September 1922 and lasted until it was largely extinguished on 22 September. It began four days after the Turkish military captured the city on 9 September, effectively ending the Greco-Turkish War, more than three years after the Greek army had landed troops at Smyrna on 15 May 1919.
